page.title: 13MUSEUMS INNERLEITHEN
page.content: {Innerleithen Museum}is on the upper floor of the old Burgh Chambers. At the entrance visitors admire the unusual rockery modelled on the heathered hills of the Leithen Valley and featuring in miniature the ancient humped backed stone bridge over the Leithen Water called the Cuddy Bridge. Amongst the many items are the Silver Arrow the oldest trophy of the St. Ronans Border Games, the De'il's head and the Crozier used in the Cleikum Ceremonies. {Scottish Museum for Wool Textiles at {Walkerburn. There is an old fashioned kitchen with a boxbed in the wall. A spinning wheel stands by the fire. We saw an 18th century loom used by the weavers in their cottages. Dyes came from plants. On display are the original designs for tartan_Balmoral tartan made 1854.
